## 

<span key="c21a932f9e91408cb174a17a7b6622b8"><span offset-key="c21a932f9e91408cb174a17a7b6622b8:0">1. Render a React component for testing</span></span>

1

<span key="641d15441bff480d9f0deb934d82cf15"><span offset-key="641d15441bff480d9f0deb934d82cf15:0">$ npx jest favorite</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

<span key="44db70867b6440148c4de0037f806463"><span offset-key="44db70867b6440148c4de0037f806463:0">To mount a React component we ReactDOM and a node on which to mount it. We can use </span>`document.createElement('div')`<span offset-key="44db70867b6440148c4de0037f806463:2"> to create a mount point, and then evaluate that </span>`div`<span offset-key="44db70867b6440148c4de0037f806463:4">'s content using query selectors.</span></span>

<span key="e2b98dbc21774fd1be216c33733d54d4">`HTMLInputElement.type`<span offset-key="e2b98dbc21774fd1be216c33733d54d4:1"> returns the type of the input.</span></span>

<span key="f5cd0217e99d46f9bcd7e1f701ee2025">`Node.textContent`<span offset-key="f5cd0217e99d46f9bcd7e1f701ee2025:1"> returns the text inside a DOM node and its descendants.</span></span>

<span key="121915d9b330433caff87a563edaecd0"><span offset-key="121915d9b330433caff87a563edaecd0:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="500699a26cb047cca20d0c3c9c1eeaec"><span offset-key="500699a26cb047cca20d0c3c9c1eeaec:0">Note: No need to install </span>`babel-jest`<span offset-key="500699a26cb047cca20d0c3c9c1eeaec:2"> manually if using Babel 7 as it's already installed when Jest is installed (see </span>`npx jest --showConfig`<span offset-key="500699a26cb047cca20d0c3c9c1eeaec:4">). To correctly transpile JSX you'll need </span>`@babel/core`<span offset-key="500699a26cb047cca20d0c3c9c1eeaec:6"> and </span>`[emailÂ protected]`<span offset-key="500699a26cb047cca20d0c3c9c1eeaec:8">. Tests will transpile JSX without any additional libraries or config.</span></span>

## 

<span key="1b76d886e9814aa5b75c72e15ea2b979"><span offset-key="1b76d886e9814aa5b75c72e15ea2b979:0">2. Use jest-dom for improved assertions</span></span>

1

<span key="f5ad2169eda249db913dd0a867e7e269"><span offset-key="f5ad2169eda249db913dd0a867e7e269:0">$ npx jest favorite</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="d52da85207904adc8a014cb88ed15874"><span offset-key="d52da85207904adc8a014cb88ed15874:0">To make assertions on DOM nodes easier we can extend expect. Instead of getting sometimes weird errors that don't explicitly point to the problem, custom matchers can provide more informative errors.</span></span>

<span key="49226fb9ed294541964a2a64fda9351f">`jest-dom`<span offset-key="49226fb9ed294541964a2a64fda9351f:1"> is a library that does the heavy lifting for us when it comes to assertions on the DOM. We have two mechanisms to extend Jest's </span>`expect`<span offset-key="49226fb9ed294541964a2a64fda9351f:3"> using </span>`jest-dom`<span offset-key="49226fb9ed294541964a2a64fda9351f:5">'s matchers:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="9392bd38d6e142a8bab51dd3ff4e32d7"><span offset-key="9392bd38d6e142a8bab51dd3ff4e32d7:0">explicitly import the matchers you want from </span>`jest-dom`<span offset-key="9392bd38d6e142a8bab51dd3ff4e32d7:2">, and then use </span>`expect.extend(// object with names of matchers to extend)`</span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="97baa18a384f4922b4a486afd3d631ea"><span offset-key="97baa18a384f4922b4a486afd3d631ea:0">import </span>`jest-dom/extend-expect`<span offset-key="97baa18a384f4922b4a486afd3d631ea:2"> to make all matchers available in the file</span></span>

<span key="5aa4a75a13cc469f976968b8c998e007"><span offset-key="5aa4a75a13cc469f976968b8c998e007:0">Another option is to use Jest's </span>`setupTestFrameworkScriptFile`<span offset-key="5aa4a75a13cc469f976968b8c998e007:2"> to extend </span>`expect`<span offset-key="5aa4a75a13cc469f976968b8c998e007:4"> for all files.</span></span>

## 

<span key="6ac8565bb9104eb89c5fe3134d64bd8b"><span offset-key="6ac8565bb9104eb89c5fe3134d64bd8b:0">3. Use dom-testing-library to write more maintainable React tests</span></span>

1

<span key="a16425521ed94c62b2fe0db612701777"><span offset-key="a16425521ed94c62b2fe0db612701777:0">$ npx jest favorite</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="21f0d4b370294f69a0546689e2f6a0b0"><span offset-key="21f0d4b370294f69a0546689e2f6a0b0:0">Querying a label by its </span>`textContent`<span offset-key="21f0d4b370294f69a0546689e2f6a0b0:2"> doesn't give us any confidence in the label actually performing its job. If the </span>`id`<span offset-key="21f0d4b370294f69a0546689e2f6a0b0:4"> attribute is not properly configured, users will not get the benefit of the label.</span></span>

<span key="965c31dcdceb419ea3adf6e8a34ffe69"><span offset-key="965c31dcdceb419ea3adf6e8a34ffe69:0">We can use </span>`dom-testing-library`<span offset-key="965c31dcdceb419ea3adf6e8a34ffe69:2"> to write tests that can better describe how UIs work and do the heavy lifting for us.</span></span>

<span key="7c20b6d943f94a21aa5e8660dc443e1d"><span offset-key="7c20b6d943f94a21aa5e8660dc443e1d:0">The </span>`queries`<span offset-key="7c20b6d943f94a21aa5e8660dc443e1d:2"> export from </span>`dom-testing-library`<span offset-key="7c20b6d943f94a21aa5e8660dc443e1d:4"> has a number of methods on it, one of which is </span>`.getByLabelText`<span offset-key="7c20b6d943f94a21aa5e8660dc443e1d:6"> which returns an </span>`HTMLInputElement`<span offset-key="7c20b6d943f94a21aa5e8660dc443e1d:8"> based on the </span>`id`<span offset-key="7c20b6d943f94a21aa5e8660dc443e1d:10"> attribute of the </span>`label`<span offset-key="7c20b6d943f94a21aa5e8660dc443e1d:12"> matching the text passed into the function.</span></span>

<span key="4363d94b4c014abdbc8b8ea52de1528e"><span offset-key="4363d94b4c014abdbc8b8ea52de1528e:0">Users are not specifically concerned with the case of the </span>`label`<span offset-key="4363d94b4c014abdbc8b8ea52de1528e:2">s text, so we can use an case insensitive regex to select the element.</span></span>

<span key="25ea4c57c2cf4b61b9620913cbdbd1fa">`dom-testing-library`<span offset-key="25ea4c57c2cf4b61b9620913cbdbd1fa:1"> has a convenient export that allows us to retrieve all the query methods that it exports but for a specific element.</span></span>

## 

<span key="7ca64df57f5d4427ad4bf5d4b0ce54e5"><span offset-key="7ca64df57f5d4427ad4bf5d4b0ce54e5:0">4. Use </span>`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="7ca64df57f5d4427ad4bf5d4b0ce54e5:2"> to render and test React Components</span></span>

1

<span key="3e97b74660d74f7e88daf50a4452f91f"><span offset-key="3e97b74660d74f7e88daf50a4452f91f:0">$ npx jest favorite</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="dcb01a7951554141a57fc78c6a71cd48"><span offset-key="dcb01a7951554141a57fc78c6a71cd48:0">If we abstract the rendering of our component, as well as getting all the queries for the container, to its own function, that function can be used to query all React components.</span></span>

<span key="c0f2809246f54dbe81bc02f0f97bd8c1"><span offset-key="c0f2809246f54dbe81bc02f0f97bd8c1:0">Turns out, this is exactly what </span>`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="c0f2809246f54dbe81bc02f0f97bd8c1:2"> does!</span></span>

## 

<span key="dc55f06fa1894b1090114d4239a8856a"><span offset-key="dc55f06fa1894b1090114d4239a8856a:0">5. Avoid Memory leaks using react-testing-libraryâ€™s cleanup function</span></span>

1

<span key="d86ad75cf5a74ca4ad400ef6535687dc"><span offset-key="d86ad75cf5a74ca4ad400ef6535687dc:0">$ npx jest favorite</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="a543afd0d9bc4cc294b2cc95397fe49a">`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="a543afd0d9bc4cc294b2cc95397fe49a:1">'s </span>`render`<span offset-key="a543afd0d9bc4cc294b2cc95397fe49a:3"> function works differently from our naive implementation.</span></span>

<span key="d9cbac65692245a3bf770efe6296777a"><span offset-key="d9cbac65692245a3bf770efe6296777a:0">React components are rendered onto the </span>`body`<span offset-key="d9cbac65692245a3bf770efe6296777a:2"> element so that we have full access to all DOM eventing.</span></span>

<span key="f3c7978e24114f17a3e3ba700058b66c"><span offset-key="f3c7978e24114f17a3e3ba700058b66c:0">The problem here is that if we don't remove attached events, and don't remove rendered components, we're prone to memory leaks and faulty tests.</span></span>

<span key="d8e0a82a2f694357b7f671f4d33bfb95"><span offset-key="d8e0a82a2f694357b7f671f4d33bfb95:0">To address this we have a few options:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="b9bf19883f6547b997ab35ab4e569f89"><span offset-key="b9bf19883f6547b997ab35ab4e569f89:0">use </span>`unmount`<span offset-key="b9bf19883f6547b997ab35ab4e569f89:2"> exported from calling </span>`render`<span offset-key="b9bf19883f6547b997ab35ab4e569f89:4"> to unmount our component once a test has run</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="685f4b0bfa364c30a2b57c0049f201d4"><span offset-key="685f4b0bfa364c30a2b57c0049f201d4:0">import </span>`cleanup`<span offset-key="685f4b0bfa364c30a2b57c0049f201d4:2"> to manually clean up the DOM after a test has run</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="085eb0368e684980b3950802883e7c23"><span offset-key="085eb0368e684980b3950802883e7c23:0">pass </span>`cleanup`<span offset-key="085eb0368e684980b3950802883e7c23:2"> to Jest's </span>`afterEach`<span offset-key="085eb0368e684980b3950802883e7c23:4"> hook to automatically clean up the DOM after each test runs</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="60c0c865130d40e3ab652c6e68d1a4ad"><span offset-key="60c0c865130d40e3ab652c6e68d1a4ad:0">import </span>`react-testing-library/cleanup-after-each`<span offset-key="60c0c865130d40e3ab652c6e68d1a4ad:2"> which will run Jest's </span>`afterEach`<span offset-key="60c0c865130d40e3ab652c6e68d1a4ad:4"> hook with </span>`cleanup`<span offset-key="60c0c865130d40e3ab652c6e68d1a4ad:6"> for us</span></span>

## 

<span key="85b32886ad4740c3bf24d9cdcc2806ed"><span offset-key="85b32886ad4740c3bf24d9cdcc2806ed:0">6. Debug the DOM state during tests using react-testing-libraryâ€™s debug function</span></span>

1

<span key="356efaa14a504d028e27e0a706251c73"><span offset-key="356efaa14a504d028e27e0a706251c73:0">$ npx jest favorite</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="4345203de3204111b0d4c701c1f5118c"><span offset-key="4345203de3204111b0d4c701c1f5118c:0">It'd be convenient if one could inspect the result of rendering a React component.</span></span>

<span key="53fc11aa1d9640898c6e8acdc7f7d428">`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="53fc11aa1d9640898c6e8acdc7f7d428:1">s </span>`render`<span offset-key="53fc11aa1d9640898c6e8acdc7f7d428:3"> method returns </span>`debug`<span offset-key="53fc11aa1d9640898c6e8acdc7f7d428:5"> function which does exactly this.</span></span>

<span key="a51ee262b0c346bbb98471741a9621c8"><span offset-key="a51ee262b0c346bbb98471741a9621c8:0">By running </span>`debug()`<span offset-key="a51ee262b0c346bbb98471741a9621c8:2"> we'll have a pretty-printed result of our component printed to the console in our tests. Passing in a queried element will render only that element.</span></span>

<span key="7c43e794ba8a4060bb2b8bdb686a627d"><span offset-key="7c43e794ba8a4060bb2b8bdb686a627d:0">7. Test React Component Event Handlers with fireEvent from react-testing-library</span></span>

<span key="0230980abb854592a823f357aaa31466"><span offset-key="0230980abb854592a823f357aaa31466:0">We can trigger events on elements by using </span>`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="0230980abb854592a823f357aaa31466:2">s </span>`fireEvent`<span offset-key="0230980abb854592a823f357aaa31466:4"> export.</span></span>

<span key="df431f19ea7f460492de242a322ed677">`fireEvent`<span offset-key="df431f19ea7f460492de242a322ed677:1"> has a number of event methods on it, such as </span>`.change`<span offset-key="df431f19ea7f460492de242a322ed677:3">, </span>`.click`<span offset-key="df431f19ea7f460492de242a322ed677:5">, etc. that can be dispatched on an element. ## 

<span key="95a75f6954c846baabb377ff03ab6500"><span offset-key="95a75f6954c846baabb377ff03ab6500:0">8. Assert rendered text with react-testing-library</span></span>

1

<span key="18522fdb52a44543bc00ac60d942c9b0"><span offset-key="18522fdb52a44543bc00ac60d942c9b0:0">$ npx jest favorite</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="9294ae3dfc1b46b091720f5c678b0ce8"><span offset-key="9294ae3dfc1b46b091720f5c678b0ce8:0">There are a number of ways we can assert that specific text exists in the DOM.</span></span>

<span key="814257b41e694ce1935714bf96777e78"><span offset-key="814257b41e694ce1935714bf96777e78:0">The first is by using the </span>`container`<span offset-key="814257b41e694ce1935714bf96777e78:2"> property exported by </span>`render`<span offset-key="814257b41e694ce1935714bf96777e78:4">, and asserting it has text using </span>`.toHaveTextContent`<span offset-key="814257b41e694ce1935714bf96777e78:6">.</span></span>

<span key="fefc311dbb494ee1bea13888c5c66386"><span offset-key="fefc311dbb494ee1bea13888c5c66386:0">The second is by using the </span>`getByText`<span offset-key="fefc311dbb494ee1bea13888c5c66386:2"> query returned by </span>`render`<span offset-key="fefc311dbb494ee1bea13888c5c66386:4"> to validate if an element exists. </span>`getByText`<span offset-key="fefc311dbb494ee1bea13888c5c66386:6"> throws an error if an element can't be found. This is true for all the </span>`get`<span offset-key="fefc311dbb494ee1bea13888c5c66386:8"> methods returned by </span>`render`<span offset-key="fefc311dbb494ee1bea13888c5c66386:10">.</span></span>

<span key="0e3c5f46ecf44b2c8cdcc33011bf2c1e"><span offset-key="0e3c5f46ecf44b2c8cdcc33011bf2c1e:0">The third is to use the </span>`getByTestId`<span offset-key="0e3c5f46ecf44b2c8cdcc33011bf2c1e:2"> method that </span>`render`<span offset-key="0e3c5f46ecf44b2c8cdcc33011bf2c1e:4"> exports along with a </span>`data-testid`<span offset-key="0e3c5f46ecf44b2c8cdcc33011bf2c1e:6"> attribute on the element whose content you want to validate exists.</span></span>

<span key="9176d394af3f43638ceb666bef17513c"><span offset-key="9176d394af3f43638ceb666bef17513c:0">10. Assert that something is NOT rendered with </span>`react-testing-library`</span>

1

<span key="5ba3d9dc74d34f18bae738e0013f13b4"><span offset-key="5ba3d9dc74d34f18bae738e0013f13b4:0">$ npx jest favorite</span></span>

Copied!

<span key="49fab353b4884def953b7feff4625f5d"><span offset-key="49fab353b4884def953b7feff4625f5d:0">The </span>`.get`<span offset-key="49fab353b4884def953b7feff4625f5d:2"> methods returned from </span>`render`<span offset-key="49fab353b4884def953b7feff4625f5d:4"> throw errors if an element can't be found in the DOM. This will result in tests erroring, even if we're testing for the non-existence of elements.</span></span>

<span key="d6538e24259048febb9208212eb19404"><span offset-key="d6538e24259048febb9208212eb19404:0">To assert that elements do not exist, there are matching </span>`.query`<span offset-key="d6538e24259048febb9208212eb19404:2"> methods that </span>`render`<span offset-key="d6538e24259048febb9208212eb19404:4"> returns that return </span>`null`<span offset-key="d6538e24259048febb9208212eb19404:6"> instead of throwing an error.</span></span>

<span key="c2e9a45e661c482794ab75855d59ff01"><span offset-key="c2e9a45e661c482794ab75855d59ff01:0">We can then use </span>`expect(queryByX()).toBeFalsy()`<span offset-key="c2e9a45e661c482794ab75855d59ff01:2"> to assert that the elements don't exist.</span></span>

<span key="3a29aa3d1add408ba9b21759aa76f750"><span offset-key="3a29aa3d1add408ba9b21759aa76f750:0">11. Test accessibility of rendered React Components with jest-axe</span></span>

<span key="22cb86a3b0a14ec1bbae4f0a7cf21756"><span offset-key="22cb86a3b0a14ec1bbae4f0a7cf21756:0">Using </span>`jest-axe`<span offset-key="22cb86a3b0a14ec1bbae4f0a7cf21756:2"> we can assert the accessibility of our components.</span></span>

<span key="b9d2674a193d4b9ea1122abe50483eba"><span offset-key="b9d2674a193d4b9ea1122abe50483eba:0">The </span>`axe`<span offset-key="b9d2674a193d4b9ea1122abe50483eba:2"> export from </span>`jest-axe`<span offset-key="b9d2674a193d4b9ea1122abe50483eba:4"> is accepts a DOM node, and is async, so we need tests containing a11y assertions to be </span>`async / await`<span offset-key="b9d2674a193d4b9ea1122abe50483eba:6">.</span></span>

<span key="159346fcecdc4fb288834d05af613f1f">`jest-axe`<span offset-key="159346fcecdc4fb288834d05af613f1f:1"> also exports a </span>`toHaveNoViolations`<span offset-key="159346fcecdc4fb288834d05af613f1f:3"> matcher which can either be made avilable in assertions using </span>`expect.extend(toHaveNoViolations)`<span offset-key="159346fcecdc4fb288834d05af613f1f:5">, or can be automatically extended on </span>`expect`<span offset-key="159346fcecdc4fb288834d05af613f1f:7"> by importing </span>`jest-axe/extend-expect`<span offset-key="159346fcecdc4fb288834d05af613f1f:9">.</span></span>

<span key="ed55197f27b34b5a9a8a99deffe107a5"><span offset-key="ed55197f27b34b5a9a8a99deffe107a5:0">13. Mock HTTP Requests with Dependency Injection in React Component Tests</span></span>

<span key="5f0180fecba14c6689503a2b86c42017">`__tests__/greeting-loader-mock-02.test.js`</span>

<span key="269f0919c1a54b4d92262268fc8c220b"><span offset-key="269f0919c1a54b4d92262268fc8c220b:0">As an alternative to mocking, one can use dependency injection by setting the api call as a default prop on the component, mocking it in the test, and passing it through explicitly.</span></span>

<span key="e89f7275841f4cd3b9df9063141eabe9"><span offset-key="e89f7275841f4cd3b9df9063141eabe9:0">This technique requires having to change your implementation of your component.</span></span>

<span key="28f90e25a9d04a7fb69f5a76c9d194c5"><span offset-key="28f90e25a9d04a7fb69f5a76c9d194c5:0">It's most useful when you're in an environment where you can't make use of Jest's mocking capabilities, such as when in Storybook.</span></span>

<span key="8ce56ae91d7447eb8407ef314f9fbf7e"><span offset-key="8ce56ae91d7447eb8407ef314f9fbf7e:0">14. Mock react-transition-group in React Component Tests with jest.mock</span></span>

<span key="fae33205b7814d40a3a3a410dd2ba443"><span offset-key="fae33205b7814d40a3a3a410dd2ba443:0">To get around this, we can mock the implementation of external libraries to remove any timeouts or delays.</span></span>

<span key="15937d0d0880435bbd0e00affba0c1ac"><span offset-key="15937d0d0880435bbd0e00affba0c1ac:0">15. Test componentDidCatch handler error boundaries with react-testing-library</span></span>

1

<span key="78758f39c7594718b73ae7a8deb5f523"><span offset-key="78758f39c7594718b73ae7a8deb5f523:0">$ npx jest error</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="cd0b4d3d60fc4d368a2b09f32a8e8ebf">`__tests__/error-boundary.test.js`</span>

<span key="e83ea6b0211c4090927baf5bee27af03"><span offset-key="e83ea6b0211c4090927baf5bee27af03:0">To test error boundaries in our </span>`error-boundary.js`<span offset-key="e83ea6b0211c4090927baf5bee27af03:2"> component we need to do a few things:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="31bcf1e5ae23494e9c08011a6216a574"><span offset-key="31bcf1e5ae23494e9c08011a6216a574:0">mock out our API request</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="226808decd924357ad011ae5646f74ea"><span offset-key="226808decd924357ad011ae5646f74ea:0">create a component that simulates an error being thrown</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="d1b8bddc402c46a79dc276aee8db0a3a"><span offset-key="d1b8bddc402c46a79dc276aee8db0a3a:0">make our test output less cluttered by mocking out </span>`console.error`</span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="05c508f0df404afc9cb77537e6d20b1b"><span offset-key="05c508f0df404afc9cb77537e6d20b1b:0">assert that </span>`console.error`<span offset-key="05c508f0df404afc9cb77537e6d20b1b:2"> is being called the correct number of times, since we may be losing important information by squashing the output</span></span>

5.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">5.</span>
    <span key="dbe2a973b89e46ecb48b74d7d9cd4543"><span offset-key="dbe2a973b89e46ecb48b74d7d9cd4543:0">assert that the </span>`reportError`<span offset-key="dbe2a973b89e46ecb48b74d7d9cd4543:2"> API call we mock is being called the correct number of times, and with the correct parameters</span></span>

6.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">6.</span>
    <span key="746bf2610bf74288bc5530d75fb52c8e"><span offset-key="746bf2610bf74288bc5530d75fb52c8e:0">assert that our component is displaying the correct text when there's an error</span></span>

7.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">7.</span>
    <span key="a1baeffd1c62447f842b9deb0bcbad41"><span offset-key="a1baeffd1c62447f842b9deb0bcbad41:0">assert that when there is no error that </span>`renderError`<span offset-key="a1baeffd1c62447f842b9deb0bcbad41:2"> is not called, and that our component does not output the error text</span></span>

<span key="e9d9428848024d7eb60e8f3ea67fbcb4"><span offset-key="e9d9428848024d7eb60e8f3ea67fbcb4:0">To mock out </span>`console.error`<span offset-key="e9d9428848024d7eb60e8f3ea67fbcb4:2"> we need to use </span>`beforeEach`<span offset-key="e9d9428848024d7eb60e8f3ea67fbcb4:4"> to mock it out before each test runs, and restore it after each test using </span>`afterEach`<span offset-key="e9d9428848024d7eb60e8f3ea67fbcb4:6">. To create the mock we need to use Jest's </span>`.spyOn`<span offset-key="e9d9428848024d7eb60e8f3ea67fbcb4:8"> method along with </span>`.mockImplementation`<span offset-key="e9d9428848024d7eb60e8f3ea67fbcb4:10">:</span></span>

1

<span key="cd42e799973d4a0c981e937d2085a1e2"><span class="r-17y197c" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="cd42e799973d4a0c981e937d2085a1e2:0">// silence console.error ouptut in our tests</span></span>

2

<span key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae"><span offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:0">jest</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:1">.</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:2">spyOn</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:3">(</span><span offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:4">console</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:5">,</span><span offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:6"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:7">'error'</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:8">).</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:9">mockImplementation</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:10">(()</span><span offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:11"> </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:12">=></span><span offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:13"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c24bc808b31c48c08cf5b07e0f428eae:14">{})</span></span>

<span key="2fb5e4c8f3634c32a4e12a6e34439378"><span offset-key="2fb5e4c8f3634c32a4e12a6e34439378:0">First we render our component without any errors. We could, at this point, assert that it's outputting as expected.</span></span>

<span key="c3f2dbea4433464bbcc224988acd8d66"><span offset-key="c3f2dbea4433464bbcc224988acd8d66:0">Then we </span>`rerender`<span offset-key="c3f2dbea4433464bbcc224988acd8d66:2"> with an error, at which point we can assert that </span>`console.error`<span offset-key="c3f2dbea4433464bbcc224988acd8d66:4"> and </span>`reportError`<span offset-key="c3f2dbea4433464bbcc224988acd8d66:6"> were called. We need to assert that </span>`renderError`<span offset-key="c3f2dbea4433464bbcc224988acd8d66:8"> was not only called, but called with the parameters that we expect, using </span>`.toHaveBeenCalledWith`<span offset-key="c3f2dbea4433464bbcc224988acd8d66:10">.</span></span>

<span key="8b8ae38f6375497dadea8e5040581880"><span offset-key="8b8ae38f6375497dadea8e5040581880:0">Instead of matching literals, we can specify constructors for Jest to match against. <span key="8e974c09101a46648a857d4bc8648d1b"><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8e974c09101a46648a857d4bc8648d1b:0">const</span><span offset-key="8e974c09101a46648a857d4bc8648d1b:1"> error </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8e974c09101a46648a857d4bc8648d1b:2">=</span><span offset-key="8e974c09101a46648a857d4bc8648d1b:3"> expect</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8e974c09101a46648a857d4bc8648d1b:4">.</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8e974c09101a46648a857d4bc8648d1b:5">any</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8e974c09101a46648a857d4bc8648d1b:6">(</span><span offset-key="8e974c09101a46648a857d4bc8648d1b:7">Error</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8e974c09101a46648a857d4bc8648d1b:8">)</span></span>

## 

<span key="01b226aa1e364db78b68cb092ce48816"><span offset-key="01b226aa1e364db78b68cb092ce48816:0">18. Test drive the API call of a React Form with react-testing-library</span></span>

1

<span key="b8f863bee63e46b7a570dbc55ccf0e61"><span offset-key="b8f863bee63e46b7a570dbc55ccf0e61:0">$ npx jest post-editor-03</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="05e16f8419fd48ab84129bc9ee67998f">`__tests__/post-editor-03-markup.test.js`</span>

<span key="7416a973ec3a4da692b8878508a06bd5"><span offset-key="7416a973ec3a4da692b8878508a06bd5:0">We need to assert that when the form is submitted that our API is called to actually save the post.</span></span>

<span key="c76a01037b66433d82d33b1f1a80fe95"><span offset-key="c76a01037b66433d82d33b1f1a80fe95:0">We don't want to make the actual request, but we do want to confirm that the function will be called and called with the correct parameters.</span></span>

<span key="928360540acc429ea88f632394c5b573"><span offset-key="928360540acc429ea88f632394c5b573:0">We need to:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="fb60593efb0847f19e4f290f66452598"><span offset-key="fb60593efb0847f19e4f290f66452598:0">mock the API call</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="505ddd9030bc4e45a09f8a7adebea689"><span offset-key="505ddd9030bc4e45a09f8a7adebea689:0">import the mocked function so we can assert against it</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="d7794e9671634b2c8302e7f710b03a54"><span offset-key="d7794e9671634b2c8302e7f710b03a54:0">clear the mock after each test so that it doesn't interfere with other tests we may add to the file</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="486c7ebe121649beab56544c1cda6021"><span offset-key="486c7ebe121649beab56544c1cda6021:0">assert the number of times its called, and the payload it receives</span></span>

<span key="8e0cd164665444a4874b1a4f336e06d0"><span offset-key="8e0cd164665444a4874b1a4f336e06d0:0">To assert that it is called with the correct payload, we need to:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="390b656a4923498cbfcca991a6fa2e4e"><span offset-key="390b656a4923498cbfcca991a6fa2e4e:0">set the values on the inputs</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>

<span key="46b06ebc89ba4956a244f4ec96a59a7d">`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="46b06ebc89ba4956a244f4ec96a59a7d:1">'s </span>`wait`<span offset-key="46b06ebc89ba4956a244f4ec96a59a7d:3"> executes each assertion every 15ms for 4s for each assertion. If there are 4 assertions inside </span>`wait`<span offset-key="46b06ebc89ba4956a244f4ec96a59a7d:5">, and 1 of them fails, we will only know after 16s.</span></span>

<span key="e674255f8e6b4802a383437ebb0fc62d"><span offset-key="e674255f8e6b4802a383437ebb0fc62d:0">It's best to keep the number of tests inside </span>`wait`<span offset-key="e674255f8e6b4802a383437ebb0fc62d:2"> as low as possible to ensure faster test runs.</span></span>

<span key="0a14f4a69dec480bbc2e0a25d4ecae1f"><span offset-key="0a14f4a69dec480bbc2e0a25d4ecae1f:0">To assert that dom nodes exist once errors are thrown from promises we need a mechanism to retrieve the elements once the promise rejected and state has been updated.</span></span>

<span key="a46c3c813f4540cf8e3c34fd2846efaf">`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="a46c3c813f4540cf8e3c34fd2846efaf:1">'s </span>`waitForElement`<span offset-key="a46c3c813f4540cf8e3c34fd2846efaf:3"> does exactly this. <span key="e0d9cc24953e430e998831a12fce5b1b"><span offset-key="e0d9cc24953e430e998831a12fce5b1b:0">Once we have that element we can assert on it.</span></span>

<span key="f82ebecd441d47c2b90353c144ed38ac"><span offset-key="f82ebecd441d47c2b90353c144ed38ac:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="8d1d14d0625a4947b790f79aaecffc59"><span offset-key="8d1d14d0625a4947b790f79aaecffc59:0">To simulate a rejection, we could change our </span>`mockSavePost`<span offset-key="8d1d14d0625a4947b790f79aaecffc59:2"> implementation, but this would cause other tests to then fail.</span></span>

<span key="cb25bcb85cd342b68da8751ba89844f7"><span offset-key="cb25bcb85cd342b68da8751ba89844f7:0">Instead, we can specify that the mock behave in a particular way inside the test, and only once.</span></span>

<span key="3f726fc48e194e0f8c580d0917e4fe12"><span offset-key="3f726fc48e194e0f8c580d0917e4fe12:0">To have </span>`mockSavePost`<span offset-key="3f726fc48e194e0f8c580d0917e4fe12:2"> reject the promise, we use Jest's </span>`mockFn.mockRejectValueOnce`<span offset-key="3f726fc48e194e0f8c580d0917e4fe12:4"> and provide a value that it will reject with.</span></span>

<span key="83e8de83c0c84311b87436483bb7309e"><span offset-key="83e8de83c0c84311b87436483bb7309e:0">24. Test React components that use the react-router Router Provider with createMemoryHistory</span></span>

<span key="d15d784f36c54c4180a1827613ea4024"><span offset-key="d15d784f36c54c4180a1827613ea4024:0">Components containing components from </span>`react-router-dom`<span offset-key="d15d784f36c54c4180a1827613ea4024:2"> require context in order for them to fucntion. <span key="782f55746584436fae6cef4a22dfd811"><span offset-key="782f55746584436fae6cef4a22dfd811:0">26. Create a custom render function to simplify tests of react-router components</span></span>

1

<span key="41752bcbcad0475c9acd53285c87aadb"><span offset-key="41752bcbcad0475c9acd53285c87aadb:0">$ npx jest main-02</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="92bbb6bac9eb4dac9d5ac2ab4c298328">`__tests__/main-02.test.js`</span>

<span key="8b8bf28dddfb49dca5163da3893e18d4"><span offset-key="8b8bf28dddfb49dca5163da3893e18d4:0">There's a lot of duplication of rendering </span>`Main`<span offset-key="8b8bf28dddfb49dca5163da3893e18d4:2"> inside a </span>`Router`<span offset-key="8b8bf28dddfb49dca5163da3893e18d4:4"> component configured with its own history in </span>`main-01.test.js`<span offset-key="8b8bf28dddfb49dca5163da3893e18d4:6">.</span></span>

<span key="0a175b7939344b25a786f67d47ce3e00"><span offset-key="0a175b7939344b25a786f67d47ce3e00:0">If we wanted to test other components containing </span>`Link`<span offset-key="0a175b7939344b25a786f67d47ce3e00:2"> and </span>`Route`<span offset-key="0a175b7939344b25a786f67d47ce3e00:4"> components we'd need to duplicate the effort again.</span></span>

<span key="759ab003014541008613ec829bb00ec4"><span offset-key="759ab003014541008613ec829bb00ec4:0">Instead, we can create a custom </span>`render`<span offset-key="759ab003014541008613ec829bb00ec4:2"> function that does the work for us. By allowing that function to accept any React component we can reuse the new </span>`render`<span offset-key="759ab003014541008613ec829bb00ec4:4"> function anywhere.</span></span>

<span key="803410c80d6e4119995372678fead153"><span offset-key="803410c80d6e4119995372678fead153:0">This new </span>`render`<span offset-key="803410c80d6e4119995372678fead153:2"> can also be moved to a test utils file that can be imported into tests and used ad-hoc where it makes sense.</span></span>

<span key="8c549ce81d6b46808bdbc05977e12ce5"><span offset-key="8c549ce81d6b46808bdbc05977e12ce5:0">30. Test a render prop component using a Jest mock function</span></span>

1

<span key="c893332804a848fd8fb2fa4f88b2a881"><span offset-key="c893332804a848fd8fb2fa4f88b2a881:0">$ npx jest toggle</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="434d60906bd14011a4def03e0dbb8047">`__tests__/toggle.test.js`</span>

<span key="87d93770d05c442ebf917b5597114a34"><span offset-key="87d93770d05c442ebf917b5597114a34:0">To test components that use the render prop strategy, we need to do a few things:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="4726ced732994d9b94c716c9a1e31596"><span offset-key="4726ced732994d9b94c716c9a1e31596:0">create a </span>`children`<span offset-key="4726ced732994d9b94c716c9a1e31596:2"> function that will be passed to the render prop that receives values from the render prop</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="88b8d79f78a84db98087d62f4d275be2"><span offset-key="88b8d79f78a84db98087d62f4d275be2:0">maintain an object that contains the latest values passed to the </span>`children`<span offset-key="88b8d79f78a84db98087d62f4d275be2:2"> function.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="2e73a2179be343d7bc0e017ce2ef039c"><span offset-key="2e73a2179be343d7bc0e017ce2ef039c:0">assert on that object that the render prop component is doing what it should be</span></span>

<span key="19f9ccfd3199440b84f82b3ac15d8c84"><span offset-key="19f9ccfd3199440b84f82b3ac15d8c84:0">Most render prop components will use this same pattern, so we can abstract this behaviour in a setup function that can be easily reused.</span></span>

## 

<span key="060cea149f4440a5be30c3368877b317"><span offset-key="060cea149f4440a5be30c3368877b317:0">31. Test React portals with react-testing-library</span></span>

1

<span key="de4a927729a2409dbb0c149aeadee6bd"><span offset-key="de4a927729a2409dbb0c149aeadee6bd:0">$ npx jest modal</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="d2c53664018146a480d8efb9fadfc86b">`__tests__/modal.test.js`</span>

<span key="1dbc92ae798a4449a698771dfb6e71e7"><span offset-key="1dbc92ae798a4449a698771dfb6e71e7:0">Testing React Portals requires no changes to how we write tests. The only difference is that when we query for elements in our tests, they will be scoped to the full DOM.</span></span>

<span key="46d943f0dec943f6be4656203ce2a4bb"><span offset-key="46d943f0dec943f6be4656203ce2a4bb:0">If we want to scope our tests specifically to where the React Portal is mounted, we can use </span>`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="46d943f0dec943f6be4656203ce2a4bb:2">s </span>`within`<span offset-key="46d943f0dec943f6be4656203ce2a4bb:4"> and pass in the node we want queries to be scoped to.</span></span>

<span key="014bfcd7dfd94d99b186c7b1a938de5b">`within`<span offset-key="014bfcd7dfd94d99b186c7b1a938de5b:1"> returns the same </span>`.query`<span offset-key="014bfcd7dfd94d99b186c7b1a938de5b:3"> and </span>`.get`<span offset-key="014bfcd7dfd94d99b186c7b1a938de5b:5"> methods that render does, but scoped to the node it is called with.</span></span>

## 

<span key="658d2bc10a82405b9fec39f823bd39f7"><span offset-key="658d2bc10a82405b9fec39f823bd39f7:0">32. Test Unmounting a React Component with react-testing-library</span></span>

1

<span key="ba135b006c41436db028dc465aebd0f0"><span offset-key="ba135b006c41436db028dc465aebd0f0:0">$ npx jest countdown</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="bf1b38088ce34840b4b28492a5acb2e8"><span offset-key="bf1b38088ce34840b4b28492a5acb2e8:0">When testing components that use timers, such as </span>`setTimeout`<span offset-key="bf1b38088ce34840b4b28492a5acb2e8:2"> and </span>`setInterval`<span offset-key="bf1b38088ce34840b4b28492a5acb2e8:4">, we don't want to be subject to the length of time those tiemrs take to execute.</span></span>

<span key="f9c8a1c6180947f1a64e0bbbe71557c6"><span offset-key="f9c8a1c6180947f1a64e0bbbe71557c6:0">To resolve this, Jest allows one to easily mock out timers using </span>`jest.useFakeTimers()`<span offset-key="f9c8a1c6180947f1a64e0bbbe71557c6:2">.</span></span>

<span key="e3d607f8273147ce9f15d52b1727bb6b"><span offset-key="e3d607f8273147ce9f15d52b1727bb6b:0">This alone isn't enough, as when running assertions when timers are running, we may end up in a position where an assertion runs before a timer has executed its callback.</span></span>

<span key="324ce44264d342dbbdc4cdae673eb52d"><span offset-key="324ce44264d342dbbdc4cdae673eb52d:0">To resolve this issue we need to wait for all pending timers to execute. Jest offers 2 mechanisms to do this:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="cc0342f0e7474390852ef230cb13333d">`jest.runAllTimers()`<span offset-key="cc0342f0e7474390852ef230cb13333d:1"> - runs all pending timers. If, however, we have a recursive </span>`setTimeout`<span offset-key="cc0342f0e7474390852ef230cb13333d:3"> calling itself, we'll end up in a loop</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1a4d5dd3da2f4f28923a1310fd39af38">`jest.runOnlyPendingTimers()`<span offset-key="1a4d5dd3da2f4f28923a1310fd39af38:1"> - this will run only the pending timers, and no other timers. This can be used for timers that call themselves recursively</span></span>

### 

<span key="9954c6effd9d41a8b2bfd5111d5e9f2e"><span offset-key="9954c6effd9d41a8b2bfd5111d5e9f2e:0">Evaluating different scenarios with timers</span></span>

<span key="479cdbd5348d47d9b25a6b7751c9a95d">`countdown.test.js`<span offset-key="479cdbd5348d47d9b25a6b7751c9a95d:1"> is evaluated for each of the following.</span></span>

<span key="b95d22ba996a42c2adfed692fbcc5f09">**Scenario 1**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="0a75c985e8ff412fb6ca4c1a4022d3a6"><span offset-key="0a75c985e8ff412fb6ca4c1a4022d3a6:0">no </span>`clearInterval`<span offset-key="0a75c985e8ff412fb6ca4c1a4022d3a6:2"> in </span>`componentWillUnmount`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ad7f8471f6e24f7a9eb43b4eda82bf26"><span offset-key="ad7f8471f6e24f7a9eb43b4eda82bf26:0">no </span>`jest.useFakeTimers()`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="61bab42c50ed46ab881187c87c940f10"><span offset-key="61bab42c50ed46ab881187c87c940f10:0">no </span>`jest.runOnlyPendingTimers()`</span>

<span key="84ad448831b5469eb35a95cbc030e748">**Result:**<span offset-key="84ad448831b5469eb35a95cbc030e748:1"> We get a false positive on </span>`setState`<span offset-key="84ad448831b5469eb35a95cbc030e748:3"> not being called, because our assertion runs before the last </span>`setState`<span offset-key="84ad448831b5469eb35a95cbc030e748:5"> is actually called.</span></span>

<span key="04f1cb7f7b1b43dbb21a771d79673eab"><span offset-key="04f1cb7f7b1b43dbb21a771d79673eab:0">Evaluating </span>`clearInterval`<span offset-key="04f1cb7f7b1b43dbb21a771d79673eab:2"> has been called, however, reveals that we're not clearning any timers - a clear indication of a memory leak.</span></span>

<span key="3321022bcea546b8b22b2a75745e405b">**Scenario 2**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a104edcd77a6449ba4a56746c898785b">`clearInterval`<span offset-key="a104edcd77a6449ba4a56746c898785b:1"> in </span>`componentWillUnmount`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="14d5127609b34cab97344ffc01d126c0"><span offset-key="14d5127609b34cab97344ffc01d126c0:0">no </span>`jest.useFakeTimers()`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="14b5b166884043ea967bb92ee29a10fa"><span offset-key="14b5b166884043ea967bb92ee29a10fa:0">no </span>`jest.runOnlyPendingTimers()`</span>

<span key="ff637f40671d41189f78bb85a776666c">**Result:**<span offset-key="ff637f40671d41189f78bb85a776666c:1"> We still get a false positive, because we've done nothing about ensuring that our timers have run.</span></span>

<span key="76e9be4ab1944ddca9051d122389b75e">`clearInterval`<span offset-key="76e9be4ab1944ddca9051d122389b75e:1"> is at least showing that it's been called, so that's one step in the right direction.</span></span>

<span key="3a1a32c92f6f4845804f33689e8817d5">**Scenario 3**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5944fb6011ed4b379c312b08342a5b4e"><span offset-key="5944fb6011ed4b379c312b08342a5b4e:0">no </span>`clearInterval`<span offset-key="5944fb6011ed4b379c312b08342a5b4e:2"> in </span>`componentWillUnmount`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a8284f88abf14f59906436c3b3ff5841">`jest.useFakeTimers()`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c55e141a75fc414cadcd864d02fedd67"><span offset-key="c55e141a75fc414cadcd864d02fedd67:0">no </span>`jest.runOnlyPendingTimers()`</span>

<span key="8751cfd7e8be49a0aec373bc3b90fa30">**Result:**<span offset-key="8751cfd7e8be49a0aec373bc3b90fa30:1"> We still get a false positive, because we've done nothing about ensuring that our timers have run.</span></span>

<span key="17068dc65e874a10b179516dab33b5fe"><span offset-key="17068dc65e874a10b179516dab33b5fe:0">The </span>`clearInterval`<span offset-key="17068dc65e874a10b179516dab33b5fe:2"> assertion is still failing.</span></span>

<span key="43d051c7077144939e800fddad58c856">**Scenario 3**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="726be0629c5045ec82b18fe49369843d"><span offset-key="726be0629c5045ec82b18fe49369843d:0">no </span>`clearInterval`<span offset-key="726be0629c5045ec82b18fe49369843d:2"> in </span>`componentWillUnmount`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="cc54d3b0d4074c20adf5fc6158a448c2"><span offset-key="cc54d3b0d4074c20adf5fc6158a448c2:0">no </span>`jest.useFakeTimers()`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="40236c0c2d4c493e9c04d93be57f53f1">`jest.runOnlyPendingTimers()`</span>

<span key="b6a11204b65640b694cb9d9e5dee2316">**Result:**<span offset-key="b6a11204b65640b694cb9d9e5dee2316:1"> Still a false positive for setState, but Jest is now indicating that we are not mocking timers - i.e., use </span>`jest.useFakeTimers()`</span>

<span key="644e7fa38ee34f53ae5a99460cc7a183">**Scenario 4**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c5608696d1a54505b77bd50d00034d0c">`clearInterval`<span offset-key="c5608696d1a54505b77bd50d00034d0c:1"> in </span>`componentWillUnmount`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="603a1a8e3a6f4f52900c6a7e2f45323d">`jest.useFakeTimers()`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="bb10f6e808f743b68b772496096140f4"><span offset-key="bb10f6e808f743b68b772496096140f4:0">no </span>`jest.runOnlyPendingTimers()`</span>

<span key="1a1436006e074038a7d17c0743ad9ee8">**Result:**<span offset-key="1a1436006e074038a7d17c0743ad9ee8:1"> Our test is passing, but who knows if in another test run that our timer will run after our assertion?</span></span>

<span key="736cfd87e3bf47de9f9876c1ca290d77">**Scenario 5**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1eb7ff949fab43468b5db56f5bd1c4ce">`clearInterval`<span offset-key="1eb7ff949fab43468b5db56f5bd1c4ce:1"> in </span>`componentWillUnmount`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a722c75fbb0a46dfaeb75c1fac52b64b"><span offset-key="a722c75fbb0a46dfaeb75c1fac52b64b:0">no </span>`jest.useFakeTimers()`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8168bffc3d0a49bcba71908d75035369">`jest.runOnlyPendingTimers()`</span>

<span key="9b345ac155c54a689ea0ae12d35ca7c1">**Result:**<span offset-key="9b345ac155c54a689ea0ae12d35ca7c1:1"> Another false positive, and we get a warning from Jest that we're not using </span>`jest.useFakeTimers()`</span>

<span key="af7331f5ba884d1e82619a0c03b6db3c">**Scenario 6**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ed9d24fb77f1446aa8b3fabd36143fbb">`clearInterval`<span offset-key="ed9d24fb77f1446aa8b3fabd36143fbb:1"> in </span>`componentWillUnmount`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f0caeb4354b44c9590fcade7d153c863">`jest.useFakeTimers()`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ce2da2ac89364b0eae027bb76d44142e">`jest.runOnlyPendingTimers()`</span>

<span key="b135fb0ec3a24616a2adf1de64186105">**Result:**<span offset-key="b135fb0ec3a24616a2adf1de64186105:1"> Our tests pass, and we know that by using </span>`jest.useFakeTimers()`<span offset-key="b135fb0ec3a24616a2adf1de64186105:3"> that </span>`setInterval`<span offset-key="b135fb0ec3a24616a2adf1de64186105:5"> is mocked, and that with </span>`jest.runOnlyPendingTimers()`<span offset-key="b135fb0ec3a24616a2adf1de64186105:7"> that our assertion will only run once all remaining timers have run.</span></span>

<a href="/my-docs/group-1/testing/install-configure-and-script-cypress-for-javascript-web-applications" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-14lw9ot r-190qawg r-z2wwpe r-rs99b7 r-4dj0k7 r-1loqt21 r-1quu1zo r-1ro0kt6 r-18u37iz r-16y2uox r-1wbh5a2 r-nsbfu8 r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"></a>
